attributes.action: Reinstate the offence of sedition into UK Law.
attributes.additional_details: All and sundry are now undermining UK Sovereignty, the UK Government and the Monarchy by openly engaging foreign powers in our domestic affairs against the peoples democratic wishes.
attributes.background: The offence of sedition was abolished by Parliament but due to the behaviour of certain individuals openly undermining democracy, the Government and the Monarchy it needs to be reinstated.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We're not sure what acts you would like to be covered by this new law. A 1977 Law Commission report found that "[t]here is probably no offence properly described as "sedition" in English law" and " there is likely to be a sufficient range of other offences covering conduct amounting to sedition".

You can read the report here: 

http://www.lawcom.gov.uk/app/uploads/2016/08/No.072-Codification-of-the-Criminal-Law-Treason-Sedition-and-Allied-Offences.pdf

You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do.
